question: What is the central content of this article?
answer:
Bell released from custody after juvenile court judge sets bail at $45,000 .
Prosecutor won't appeal ruling in Bell case .
Bell and five other black teens are accused of beating white student Justin Barker .
Beating followed white students hanging nooses from a tree on school grounds .
choiceA: the release of Mychal Bell, a black teenager accused of beating a white classmate and who was the last of the "Jena 6" behind bars, after a juvenile court judge set his bail at $45,000. The article discusses the protests and demonstrations that took place in Jena over the handling of the teens' cases, as well as the decision by LaSalle Parish District Attorney Reed Walters not to appeal a higher court's decision moving Bell's case to juvenile court. It also mentions the stress and notoriety that the town has been subjected to due to the racial tension surrounding the incident.
choiceB: Mychal Bell, a black teenager accused of beating a white classmate and who was the last of the "Jena 6" behind bars, was released from custody Thursday after a juvenile court judge set his bail at $45,000. Supporters surround Mychal Bell on Thursday after his release at the LaSalle Parish courthouse. Bell's release followed an announcement from LaSalle Parish District Attorney Reed Walters, who said he would not appeal a higher court's decision moving Bell's case to juvenile court. Wearing a blue striped golf shirt and jeans, Bell walked out of the LaSalle Parish courthouse a week after an estimated 15,000-plus demonstrators marched through Jena -- a town of about 3,000 -- to protest local authorities' handling of the teens' case. "We do not condone violence of any kind, but we ask that people be given a fair and even chance at the bar of justice," the Rev. Al Sharpton said outside the courthouse. "Tonight, Mychal can go home, but Mychal is not out of the juvenile process. He goes home because a lot of people left their home and stood up for him," he said. "Let America know -- we are not fighting for the right to fight in school. We're not fighting for the right for kids to beat each other. We're fighting to say that there must be one level of justice for everybody. And you cannot have adult attempted murder for some, and a fine for others, and call that equal protection under the law. Two wrongs don't make one civil right." Demonstrators at last week's march were protesting how authorities handled the cases of Bell and five other teens accused of beating fellow student Justin Barker. Many said they were angry that the students, dubbed the Jena 6, were being treated more harshly than three white students who hung nooses from an oak tree on Jena High School property. The white students were suspended from school but did not face criminal charges. The protesters said they should have been charged with a hate crime. Bell's attorney Lewis Scott said the teen was moved from jail to a juvenile facility earlier Thursday. Walters said his decision not to appeal was based on what he believed was best for the victim in the case. "While I believe that a review would have merit ... I believe it is in the best interest of the victim and his family not to delay this matter any further and move it to its conclusion," Walters told reporters.  Watch the Rev. Al Sharpton discuss the teen's release » . He said last week's march, which included Sharpton and Martin Luther King III, did not influence his decision. Bell, now 17, was the only one of the Jena 6 behind bars. His bond previously was set at $90,000. A district judge earlier this month tossed out Bell's conviction for conspiracy to commit second-degree battery, saying the matter should have been handled in juvenile court. The 3rd Circuit Court of Appeal in Lake Charles, Louisiana, did the same with Bell's battery conviction in mid-September. Prosecutors originally charged all six black students accused of being involved in beating Barker with second-degree attempted murder and conspiracy. Walters reduced charges against at least four of them -- Bell, Robert Bailey Jr., Carwin Jones and Theo Shaw -- to battery and conspiracy. Bryant Purvis awaits arraignment. Charges against Jesse Ray Beard, who was 14 at the time of the alleged crime, are unavailable because he's a juvenile. Wednesday, Gov. Kathleen Blanco announced that Louisiana State Police officers will protect the families of the Jena 6 and investigate any threats they have received. A white supremacist Web site posted the names and addresses of the six black teens after last week's march, calling on followers to "let them know justice is coming." Thursday, the FBI said it had been made aware of allegations of threats. "Threats are taken seriously, and as these investigations are ongoing we cannot comment further," said Sheila Thorne of the FBI's office in New Orleans, Louisiana. The December 4 attack on Barker came after months of racial tension, including at least two instances of fighting in the town, sparked originally when three white teens hung the nooses. Walters has said there was no direct link between the hanging of the nooses and the schoolyard attack, and defended the prosecutions ahead of last Thursday's peaceful march. Blanco defended the prosecutor Wednesday, saying, "He has a solid record and is highly respected among his peers
choiceC: 'Mychal Bell, a black teenager accused of beating a white classmate, was released from custody after a juvenile court judge set his bail at $45,000.'
choiceD: 'the release of Mychal Bell, a black teenager from the "Jena 6" case, who was accused of beating a white classmate. Bell\'s release comes after a juvenile court judge set bail at $45,000, and the district attorney decided not to appeal the case to juvenile court. The article also discusses the controversy surrounding the unequal treatment of the Jena 6 compared to white students involved in a similar incident, as well as protests and calls for justice.'
content: (CNN) -- Mychal Bell, a black teenager accused of beating a white classmate and who was the last of the "Jena 6" behind bars, was released from custody Thursday after a juvenile court judge set his bail at $45,000. Supporters surround Mychal Bell on Thursday after his release at the LaSalle Parish courthouse. Bell's release followed an announcement from LaSalle Parish District Attorney Reed Walters, who said he would not appeal a higher court's decision moving Bell's case to juvenile court. Wearing a blue striped golf shirt and jeans, Bell walked out of the LaSalle Parish courthouse a week after an estimated 15,000-plus demonstrators marched through Jena -- a town of about 3,000 -- to protest local authorities' handling of the teens' case. "We do not condone violence of any kind, but we ask that people be given a fair and even chance at the bar of justice," the Rev. Al Sharpton said outside the courthouse. "Tonight, Mychal can go home, but Mychal is not out of the juvenile process. He goes home because a lot of people left their home and stood up for him," he said. "Let America know -- we are not fighting for the right to fight in school. We're not fighting for the right for kids to beat each other. We're fighting to say that there must be one level of justice for everybody. And you cannot have adult attempted murder for some, and a fine for others, and call that equal protection under the law. Two wrongs don't make one civil right." Demonstrators at last week's march were protesting how authorities handled the cases of Bell and five other teens accused of beating fellow student Justin Barker. Many said they were angry that the students, dubbed the Jena 6, were being treated more harshly than three white students who hung nooses from an oak tree on Jena High School property. The white students were suspended from school but did not face criminal charges. The protesters said they should have been charged with a hate crime. Bell's attorney Lewis Scott said the teen was moved from jail to a juvenile facility earlier Thursday. Walters said his decision not to appeal was based on what he believed was best for the victim in the case. "While I believe that a review would have merit ... I believe it is in the best interest of the victim and his family not to delay this matter any further and move it to its conclusion," Walters told reporters.  Watch the Rev. Al Sharpton discuss the teen's release » . He said last week's march, which included Sharpton and Martin Luther King III, did not influence his decision. Bell, now 17, was the only one of the Jena 6 behind bars. His bond previously was set at $90,000. A district judge earlier this month tossed out Bell's conviction for conspiracy to commit second-degree battery, saying the matter should have been handled in juvenile court. The 3rd Circuit Court of Appeal in Lake Charles, Louisiana, did the same with Bell's battery conviction in mid-September. Prosecutors originally charged all six black students accused of being involved in beating Barker with second-degree attempted murder and conspiracy. Walters reduced charges against at least four of them -- Bell, Robert Bailey Jr., Carwin Jones and Theo Shaw -- to battery and conspiracy. Bryant Purvis awaits arraignment. Charges against Jesse Ray Beard, who was 14 at the time of the alleged crime, are unavailable because he's a juvenile. Wednesday, Gov. Kathleen Blanco announced that Louisiana State Police officers will protect the families of the Jena 6 and investigate any threats they have received. A white supremacist Web site posted the names and addresses of the six black teens after last week's march, calling on followers to "let them know justice is coming." Thursday, the FBI said it had been made aware of allegations of threats. "Threats are taken seriously, and as these investigations are ongoing we cannot comment further," said Sheila Thorne of the FBI's office in New Orleans, Louisiana. The December 4 attack on Barker came after months of racial tension, including at least two instances of fighting in the town, sparked originally when three white teens hung the nooses. Walters has said there was no direct link between the hanging of the nooses and the schoolyard attack, and defended the prosecutions ahead of last Thursday's peaceful march. Blanco defended the prosecutor Wednesday, saying, "He has a solid record and is highly respected among his peers." Walters also addressed the stress and notoriety the town has been subjected to, saying the only way he and other residents "have been able to endure the trauma that has been thrust upon us is through the prayers of the Christian people who have sent them up in this community." He also suggested that some kind of "disaster" was averted when thousands of marchers came to Jena last week. "I firmly believe and am confident of the fact that had it not been for the direct intervention of the Lord Jesus Christ last Thursday, a disaster would have happened," Walters said. "The Lord Jesus Christ put his influence on those people, and they responded accordingly," he said, without explaining exactly what he meant. Soon after the district attorney spoke, a local reverend took issue with his comments. "Obviously, we are serving two different gods here," the Rev. Donald Sidley said. "My Bible says that we should do -- we should be loving, love your neighbor as yourself. "For him to try and separate the community like he is and then using Christ Jesus to influence the people that Jesus is working on their side, well, that's -- that's absurd. ... God is god of the human race," said Sidley, of the New Evergreen Church.  E-mail to a friend .

question: What is the central content of this article?
answer:
NEW: Morgan Tsvangirai in Botswana for medical treatment on Saturday .
NEW: Prime minister will return to Zimbabwe on Wednesday to attend wife's funeral .
Tsvangirai believes fatal car crash was deliberate, officials say .
Head-on collision bound to raise suspicion of foul play, analysts say .
choiceA: the investigation into the death of Zimbabwe's prime minister's wife in a car crash, with suspicions of foul play raised by the prime minister and his political party.
choiceB: about the car accident involving Morgan Tsvangirai, the Prime Minister of Zimbabwe, and his wife Susan. The article discusses the incident, the subsequent investigation, and the suspicions surrounding it. It also touches on the political context, including the power-sharing agreement between Tsvangirai and President Robert Mugabe and the reactions from various individuals, including Tsvangirai's party members, a former U.S. diplomat, and an American ambassador to Zimbabwe.
choiceC: "Zimbabwe's Prime Minister Morgan Tsvangirai's wife, Susan, was killed in a car crash, and the Prime Minister believes the driver deliberately drove towards them."
choiceD: "The central content of the article is the suspicious car accident that killed Zimbabwe's Prime Minister Morgan Tsvangirai's wife, Susan, and the concerns raised by his political party, the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC), about possible foul play. They believe Tsvangirai believes the driver intentionally targeted them, and there are calls for an outside investigation due to past incidents involving political opponents in similar accidents involving President Robert Mugabe."
content: HARARE, Zimbabwe (CNN)  -- Zimbabwe's prime minister believes the driver of the truck that struck his car, killing his wife, deliberately drove toward them, his party told CNN. Morgan Tsvangirai leaves the hospital Saturday after being treated for injuries from a car crash. Members of his political party, the Movement for Democratic Change, and former U.S. diplomat also say the crash raises suspicions of foul play. The prime minister left a hospital Saturday, a day after his wife, Susan, was killed in the collision, officials said. A ball cap covered Tsvangirai's bandaged head. Tsvangirai was taken to a hospital in Gaborone, Botswana, on Saturday for medical treatment, a Botswanan government source and a source with the prime minister's party. "He's badly bruised and is receiving treatment," the Botswanan government source said. The source with the prime minister's party said Tsvangirai will return to Zimbabwe on Wednesday to attend the funeral of his wife. The couple, who were married in 1978, have six children. The crash happened on a two-lane highway between Tsvangirai's hometown, Buhera, and the capital, Harare. It comes only weeks after the start of a power-sharing agreement between Tsvangirai and his political rival, President Robert Mugabe. Tsvangirai's political party said Friday that it was too early to tell whether the crash was anything other than an accident. But on Saturday, MDC members told CNN that Tsvangirai thought the crash was deliberate. Tendai Biti, the MDC secretary-general, speaking during a tearful press conference, said Tsvangirai should have had better security.  Watch how the accident threatens to derail the unity government » . "If there had been a police escort maybe what happened yesterday could have not have happened," Biti said. "(A) police escort would have warned oncoming vehicles of a VIP arriving. I think authorities must understand the omission. "We hope that this omission will be rectified, that the prime minister must be given the protection that ought to be accorded to a prime minister." Biti said the MDC would launch its own investigation. Analysts say the crash raises suspicions of foul play. One former U.S. diplomat called for an outside investigation, saying it was not the first time one of Mugabe's political foes had been killed or injured in a car crash. Tsvangirai, Zimbabwe's main opposition leader, took office last month under a power-sharing deal with Mugabe following a contentious election. The MDC reached the agreement with Mugabe in September after months of angry dispute that included violence. More than 200 deaths, mainly opposition supporters, were reported leading up to and after the election. "I'm skeptical about any motor vehicle accident in Zimbabwe involving an opposition figure," said Tom McDonald, the U.S. ambassador to Zimbabwe from 1997 to 2001. "President Mugabe has a history of strange car accidents when someone lo and behold dies -- it's sort of his M.O., of how they get rid of people they don't like."  Watch more on the fatal crash » . McDonald cited the car crash deaths of Defense Minister Moven Mahachi in 2001, Employment Minister Border Gezi in 1999 and Elliot Manyika, a government minister and former regional governor, last year. "So when I hear that Tsvangirai was in an accident, it gives me pause," McDonald said. Now an attorney with the Washington law firm Baker Hostetler, he urged a full independent investigation. However, he added that traffic accidents are common in Zimbabwe. The highway Tsvangirai was traveling on was only two lanes and tractor-trailers were common, McDonald said. Vehicles in the country were often in bad shape and drivers inexperienced. "It's certainly plausible that this was just one of those tragic things," he said. CNN's Nkepile Mabuse contributed to this report.

question: What is the central content of this article?
answer:
Ahmadinejad: "We do not wish the scandals of the Bush era to be repeated"
Iran has been in gripped in post-election violence for two weeks .
Obama has said that Iranians must be permitted to demonstrate peacefully .
U.S. president secretly wrote to Iran's supreme leader before the election .
choiceA: a clash between Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and the U.S. President, Barack Obama, over the state of U.S.-Iran relations and the recent disputed presidential election in Iran. The article discusses Ahmadinejad's criticism of Obama's inexperience and his comparison to former U.S. President George W. Bush, as well as Obama's outreach efforts towards Iran and his concerns about the legitimacy of the election.
choiceB: that Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad criticized US President Obama for his handling of Iran's affairs, comparing him unfavorably to President George W. Bush and suggesting he apologize for interfering in Iran's internal matters. Ahmadinejad also expressed that Obama should gain more experience before making decisions regarding Iran. The article further mentions the recent unrest in Iran following the disputed presidential election, with reports of security crackdowns and deaths. Additionally, it touches on Obama's cautious approach towards Iran, including withdrawing invitations to Iranian diplomats and expressing support for peaceful resolution.
choiceC: "Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad criticizes US President Obama, calling him inexperienced and suggesting he apologize for interfering in Iran's affairs."
choiceD: "The central content of the article is the reaction of Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad to President Barack Obama's approach to the disputed presidential election in Iran, with Ahmadinejad criticizing Obama's experience and urging an apology for what he perceives as interference in Iran's internal affairs. Ahmadinejad also defends the election results and calls on Obama to respect Iran's sovereignty."
content: TEHRAN, Iran (CNN)  -- Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on Thursday called the U.S. president inexperienced, compared him unfavorably to President George W. Bush and suggested he apologize for "interfering in Iran's affairs." Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad lashed out at President Obama on Thursday. "Do you think that this kind of behavior is going to solve any of your problems? It will only make people think you are someone like Bush," the semiofficial Fars news agency quoted Ahmadinejad as saying. "You are at the beginning of your way and you are gaining experience, and we do not wish the scandals of the Bush era to be repeated during your term of office," the Iranian leader said. President Obama, who has been in office for five months, has been treading a careful line on Iran, which has seen two weeks of street demonstrations following a disputed presidential election there. Watch how U.S.-Iran relations got to this point . Pro-government security forces have cracked down on the protests, with officials saying 17 people have died. Unofficial reports suggest the number is much higher. Official results gave Ahmadinejad a 2-to-1 victory over his nearest rival, former Prime Minister Mir Hossein Moussavi. Moussavi says the results were rigged. Obama has said Iranians must be free to demonstrate peacefully, and his administration Wednesday withdrew invitations to Iranian diplomats around the world to attend U.S. embassy Fourth of July parties. The extension of invitations last month was seen as a cautious outreach to Iran, which has not had diplomatic relations with Washington for 30 years. Obama wrote secretly to Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, before the election, Iranian sources confirmed Wednesday.  See photos from post-election violence » . Obama said Tuesday that Iran's government must justify itself not in the eyes of the United States, but in the opinion of its own people. "A sizable percentage of the Iranian people themselves ... consider this election illegitimate," he said at a White House news conference. "It is not too late for the Iranian government to recognize that there is a peaceful path that will lead to stability and prosperity," he said. "We hope they take it."  Timeline of election violence » . Ahmadinejad said Thursday that even 5- and 6-year-olds would not allow insults to the Iranian nation, telling Obama: "We hope that you will avoid interfering in Iran's affairs and somehow express your regret so that the Iranian nation can become aware of your regret. If there is real change, the Iranian nation will welcome it."

question: I'm in Australia.  What should I look for in an online stock broker, for trading mostly on the ASX?
answer: 'The key points of the answer are that OptionsXpress is recommended for trading on the ASX in Australia due to its user-friendly features, including virtual trading for practice, low fees, and the ability to convert to USD for trading US stocks, although the ASX volume may not be sufficient for some traders.'
choiceA:
When choosing an online stock broker for trading mostly on the ASX (Australian Securities Exchange), you should look for the following features:

1. ASX-compatible platform: Ensure that the broker offers a platform or app specifically designed for trading on the ASX, as it will have all the necessary tools and information related to Australian stocks.

2. Liquidity and order execution: Check the broker's reputation for providing high liquidity in the markets and efficient order execution, especially when trading in popular Australian stocks.

3. Fees and commission: Compare the fees and commission structure of different brokers to find one that fits your budget and trading needs. Some brokers may offer lower fees for trades or account balances above a certain threshold.

4. Research tools and analysis: Look for a broker with comprehensive research tools, including real-time quotes, charts, technical analysis, and news updates specific to the ASX.

5. Customer support: Choose a broker with reliable customer support, such as phone, email, or live chat, to assist you with any questions or issues related to trading on the ASX.

6. Account types and features: Consider the different account types offered by the broker, such as standard, professional, or institutional accounts, and choose one that suits your trading style and experience level.

7. Security and compliance: Ensure that the broker is regulated and compliant with Australian financial regulations, such as ASIC (Australian Securities and Investments Commission) and MFAA (Market Participants).

8. Trading instruments: Verify if the broker offers other financial instruments besides stocks, such as ETFs, options, or futures, to diversify your portfolio.

9. Mobile accessibility: Check if the broker's platform is accessible on mobile devices, as this can be convenient for on-the-go trading.

10. User experience and interface: Evaluate the user experience and ease of use of the broker's platform to ensure it meets your expectations and trading needs.
choiceB:
When considering an online stock broker for trading on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), there are several factors to look for to ensure you have a suitable service. Firstly, the broker should be registered with the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) and have a good reputation. You should also consider their fees and charges, including any platform access fees, account management fees, transaction fees, and spread. A reliable broker should offer low transaction costs to minimize your trading expenses. Additionally, it's important to evaluate the range of investment products they offer, such as stocks, ETFs, and funds. The user interface should be user-friendly, and the broker should provide educational resources or tools to help you make informed trading decisions. It's also beneficial to check if the broker offers real-time market data and analysis tools, as well as mobile trading apps for convenience. Lastly, customer support should be readily available and responsive to address any queries or issues you may encounter.

Considering these factors, you might want to research various online stock brokers in Australia, read reviews and comparisons, and perhaps even contact their customer service to get a better understanding of their services before making a decision.
choiceC: 'Low fees, competitive commissions, a user-friendly platform, reliable customer support, and a wide range of investment products including Australian shares, ETFs, and options. Additionally, consider a broker that offers a demo account or a low-cost starter package for beginners, and one that is regulated by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC).'
choiceD:
'When choosing an online stock broker for trading on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), consider the following factors:

1. **Platform:** Look for a user-friendly and responsive platform that offers real-time ASX market data and easy access to trade stocks.
2. **Commission and fees:** Compare brokerage fees, including trading commissions, account maintenance, and any additional charges.
3. **Account types:** Ensure they offer suitable accounts for retail or self-directed investors, with different features based on your needs (e.g., margin lending or retirement accounts).
4. **Research tools:** Access to research reports, charts, and market analysis can be helpful for informed decisions.
5. **Security and regulation:** Check if the broker is ASIC-regulated (Australian Securities and Investments Commission) for safety and compliance.
6. **Customer support:** Good customer service is crucial, especially for any questions or issues that may arise.
7. **Mobile app:** A mobile app with ASX trading capabilities is convenient for on-the-go access.
8. **Trading options:** Look for a broker that supports multiple trading platforms, including web, mobile, and API access for advanced traders.
9. **Deposit and withdrawal methods:** Ensure they have convenient and secure payment options, like bank transfers or electronic funds.

Remember to read reviews, compare brokers, and consider your own trading requirements before making a decision.'

question: F-1 Visa expired - Unable to repay private student loan. What to do?
answer: "If an individual's F-1 visa has expired and they are unable to repay a private student loan, they should contact the loan servicing company to discuss options for renegotiating terms, possibly by reducing the interest rate or extending the payment schedule. Avoid defaulting as it may affect future opportunities in the US. Explore alternative financing in their home country, continue making payments, even if it's a partial payment, to demonstrate willingness to repay and avoid defaulting unintentionally."
choiceA:
If your F-1 visa has expired and you are unable to repay your private student loan, there are a few options you can consider:

1. Contact your loan servicer: Reach out to the institution that holds your private student loan to discuss repayment options. They may be able to work with you to modify your loan terms or provide other assistance.

2. Consider deferment or forbearance: Many private student loans offer options for deferment or forbearance, which temporarily suspend payments while you seek alternative solutions. Check with your loan servicer to see if this is an option for you.

3. Explore income-driven repayment plans: Some private student loans offer income-driven repayment plans that can help you make more manageable monthly payments based on your income. Contact your loan servicer to learn more about these options.

4. Seek legal advice: If you believe your situation meets certain criteria, you may be eligible for a loan forgiveness program. Consult with a lawyer who specializes in student loan issues to explore your options further.

5. Consider transferring to a school with a better reputation: Applying to a different school with a better reputation may improve your chances of receiving financial aid, such as grants or scholarships, to help you pay off your loans.
choiceB:
As a knowledgeable expert, I would advise the following steps if your F-1 Visa has expired and you are unable to repay your private student loan:

1. Contact the Loan Company: Reach out to your private student loan company immediately to explain your situation. They may have options such as deferment, forbearance, or other repayment modifications that could help you manage your loan payments during this time.

2. Review Loan Terms: Carefully review the terms of your loan agreement to understand any available options or protections. Some loans may offer temporary payment suspension or reduced monthly payments during times of financial hardship.

3. Seek Financial Advice: Consult with a financial advisor or counselor who can provide guidance on your specific situation and suggest strategies to manage your debt.

4. Explore Repayment Options: Look into income-driven repayment plans or loan forgiveness programs that may be available based on your circumstances.

5. Consider a Consolidation Loan: If appropriate, you might consider consolidating your private student loans into a new loan with a lower interest rate or more favorable terms, which could make monthly payments more manageable.

6. Seek Assistance from Educational Institutions: If you were attending an educational institution, reach out to them for any resources or support they may offer for students facing financial difficulties.

7. File for Bankruptcy: As a last resort, if you cannot find alternative solutions and are facing severe financial distress, you might consider exploring bankruptcy as a means to discharge your student loan debt, but this should be a major consideration after all other options have been exhausted.

It's important to act promptly and seek professional advice to navigate this challenging situation effectively.
choiceC:
"You can consider the following options:

File for an F-1 visa reinstatement with your school: If you're unable to repay your private student loan due to circumstances beyond your control, you may be able to file for an F-1 visa reinstatement with your school. This will allow you to continue studying and potentially resolve your financial issues.

Reach out to your lender: Contact your private student loan lender to discuss possible deferment or forbearance options. They may be willing to work with you to temporarily suspend or reduce your payments.

Seek financial assistance: Look into government-backed federal student loans or other forms of financial aid that may be available to help you repay your private student loan. You can also explore non-profit organizations that provide financial assistance for students in similar situations.

Consider a payment plan: If you're unable to pay off the entire loan amount at once, you may be able to negotiate a payment plan with your lender. This will allow you to make smaller, more manageable payments over time.

Explore loan forgiveness programs: Depending on your profession or circumstances, you may be eligible for loan forgiveness programs that can help eliminate some or all of your debt."
choiceD:
"If your F-1 visa has expired and you are unable to repay a private student loan, there are a few steps you can consider:

1. Contact the lender: Explain your situation and ask if they offer any deferment, forbearance, or hardship programs that might temporarily pause payments or adjust the payment plan.

2. Explore options for loan consolidation or refinance: Look for lenders that specialize in international student loans or those with flexible repayment terms for non-residents.

3. Seek legal advice: Consult an immigration attorney or a lawyer experienced in student debt to understand your rights and potential solutions.

4. Apply for a grace period or hardship discharge (if applicable): Some lenders may provide a grace period after your visa expires, but this is not guaranteed.

5. Explore your country's support: If you're still in the US, check if your home country's embassy or consulate offers any financial assistance or if there are community resources available.

6. Consider a repayment plan once your status is resolved: If you plan to return to your studies or obtain a work permit, discuss future repayment options with the lender.

Remember that these steps may not guarantee a full resolution, but they can help you navigate the situation. It's crucial to act promptly and be transparent with your lender."

question: How is a Condominium / Apartment Building fiscally identified?
answer: 'A condominium or apartment building is fiscally identified through an EIN, functioning类似a business, and requires reserve funds for maintenance and emergencies, which should be interest-bearing.'
choiceA: A condominium or apartment building is fiscally identified by its unique property tax identification number (PTIN). This number is assigned by the local government and is used to assess and collect property taxes on the building and its contents.
choiceB: A condominium or apartment building is fiscally identified through a system of shared ownership and expenses among the residents. Each unit owner holds ownership of their individual unit and shares ownership of common areas in the building, such as hallways, lobbies, and amenities. The financial management of these shared areas is typically overseen by an elected board of directors or a homeowners association (HOA). The HOA is responsible for collecting fees from the residents to cover the costs of maintaining and operating the common areas, as well as other expenses like repairs, insurance, and upgrades. These fees are usually set annually and can vary depending on the size of the unit, the amenities provided, and the cost of maintaining the common areas. The HOA may also generate revenue through rental income from available units within the complex or by offering services such as landscaping, maintenance, and security. Financial records are maintained by the HOA, which includes budgeting, auditing, and financial reporting to ensure transparency and compliance with local laws and regulations.
choiceC: 'A condominium building is typically fiscally identified as a pass-through entity, meaning that the individual unit owners are responsible for paying property taxes, insurance, and other expenses specific to their unit, while the condominium association or homeowners association (HOA) handles shared expenses such as common area maintenance and repairs.'
choiceD: "A Condominium or Apartment Building is typically fiscally identified by its property tax parcel number, which is a unique identifier assigned by local authorities for property assessment and taxation purposes. This number allows the local government to track and collect taxes based on the property's assessed value."

question: What does this diagram from Robert Kiyosaki about corporations mean?
answer: 'The diagram from Robert Kiyosaki appears to promote potentially illegal tax strategies, as it suggests using a corporation to cover personal expenses, which is a tactic that led to legal trouble for Leona Helmsley.'
choiceA: The diagram from Robert Kiyosaki about corporations represents the concept of a "flow-through" entity. In this context, a flow-through entity is a type of business structure that allows the profits and losses to pass through to the owners (individuals) for tax purposes, rather than having separate corporate income and expenses. This means that the owners are not responsible for paying taxes on the company's profits or losses, but instead only pay taxes on their share of the flow-through income or expenses.
choiceB: The diagram from Robert Kiyosaki, a well-known author of books on personal finance and investing, typically refers to the concept of 'Financial Independence'. The diagram is often used in his book 'Rich Dad Poor Dad'. In this context, the diagram can be interpreted as illustrating the difference between an employment-based income (having a day job) versus an investment-based income (having assets that generate passive income). The left side of the diagram represents the 'Employer Rebellion' zone, where individuals work for a salary and rely on their employer for financial stability. The right side of the diagram represents the 'Business Rebellion' zone, where individuals have created a business or invested in assets that generate passive income. This shift from employment-based income to investment-based income is seen as a key step towards achieving financial independence. The diagram emphasizes the importance of understanding the different paths to wealth creation and making conscious financial decisions to build one's wealth.
choiceC: 'The diagram shows the three main types of entities: E-Myth (Employee), S-Myth (Self-Employed), and B-Myth (Business Owner). The E-Myth represents the employee who trades time for money, while the S-Myth represents the self-employed individual who trades time for money but has more control. The B-Myth represents the business owner who creates assets that generate passive income.'
choiceD: 'The diagram from Robert Kiyosaki likely represents the concept of an ownership structure between a corporation and its shareholders. It may show the difference between a "贫民" (poor person) who works for wages, an "员工" (employee) who contributes labor, a "老板" (boss/employer) who owns the business, and a "企业主" (business owner) or "股东" (shareholder) who owns a portion of the company through stocks. The idea is that being a shareholder allows one to profit from the corporation\'s success without directly managing it, unlike employees who receive only a limited return on their labor. The diagram might emphasize the wealth-building potential of owning a piece of a business rather than just working for one.'

question: Anonymous CC: Does “Entropay” really not hand my personal data over to a company - are there alternatives?
answer: 'Entropay offers anonymous prepaid and stored value cards, with a $500 loading limit, which are exempt from border declaration in the US due to Treasury and Customs regulations. These cards have fees but are generally anonymous, with the exception of tax and stock market integrity concerns. The UK may have more anonymity options, potentially including higher limit cards, for global citizens.'
choiceA:
Entropay is a payment method that allows users to make purchases without sharing their credit card information. It uses a unique code, known as the "Entropay Card," which is linked to your bank account and can be used online or in physical stores. This ensures that your personal data is not shared with any third-party companies.

However, there are other alternatives to consider:

1. PayPal: Although it is not completely anonymous like Entropay, PayPal does offer a level of privacy by not requiring users to provide their full name or address.

2. Bitcoin: Using Bitcoin allows you to send and receive payments without revealing your identity. However, it may not be suitable for all transactions, and there are limitations on the amount you can send or receive.

3. LocalBitcoins: This platform allows you to buy and sell bitcoins in your local area, making it a more private alternative to traditional payment methods.

4. Cash: If you prefer the highest level of anonymity, using cash is always an option.

Remember that no payment method is completely anonymous, but these alternatives can help minimize the risk of your personal data being shared with third parties.
choiceB: In the context of Entropay, it is important to clarify that Entropay is a digital payments company that provides secure payment processing solutions. When it comes to personal data and privacy, Entropay typically ensures that customer data is handled securely and in compliance with relevant data protection laws. This means that Entropay maintains strict data protection measures to safeguard customer information. As for alternatives to Entropay, there are other payment service providers that also prioritize user privacy and data security. It is advisable for users to research and compare different payment options based on their specific needs, preferences, and the level of privacy they require.
choiceC:
"Entropay is a virtual payment card service that stores your financial information securely and generates a new 16-digit card number for each transaction. While Entropay claims to keep your personal data private, it's still owned by Mastercard, which means your financial information is technically stored with a major credit card company. However, Entropay has strict security measures in place to protect your data.

If you're concerned about handing over your personal data, consider alternative options:

1. Prepaid cards: Companies like Prepaid2Give or Prepaid Mastercard offer prepaid cards with no personal data required.
2. Cryptocurrencies: Services like BitPay or Coinbase allow you to make payments using cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, which don't involve sharing personal data.
3. Digital wallets: Digital wallets like PayPal or Skrill offer secure payment processing without requiring sensitive personal information.
4. Cash or bank transfers: Direct cash deposits or wire transfers can be used for online transactions, eliminating the need for payment processors altogether."
choiceD: 'Entropay claims to provide a secure service where it does not share your personal data with third parties without your consent. However, as with any financial service, there might be some necessary data sharing for regulatory and transaction purposes. To avoid handing over personal data to a company directly, you could consider using cryptocurrencies, prepaid cards (like gift cards), or services that offer enhanced privacy features like Monero, Brave, or a hardware security wallet. These alternatives can help protect your personal information to varying degrees.'
